The sites of published pollen records from southern Patagonia that are discussed herein are (see PALEOENVIRONMENTS AND PALEOCLIMATES IN TIERRA DEL FUEGO AND SOUTHERNMOST PATAGONIA, SOUTH AMERICA 57 Fig. 1 for location -)Viamonte, an interstadial peat outcrop (54 ° 11 'S, 66 ° 21 ` W, 5 m elevation) (Auer, 1956 -)Puerto Eden, a peat bog in the Chilean Channels rainforest/moorland vegetation (49 ° 8 'S, 74 ° 25 ` W, 20 m elevation) (Ashworth et al1991 -)Harberton, a bog section in deciduous Nothofagus pumilio-Nothofagus antarctica forest (54 ° 53 'S, 67 ° 10 ` W, 30m elevation) (Markgraf, 1989b, 1991a ; Heusser, 1989 -)Paso Garibaldi, a bog section from ca. 100 m below the upper Nothofagus pumilio Nothofagus antarctica treeline (54 ° 43 'S, 67 ° 50 ` W, 500 m elevation ; Markgraf, 1990 -)Cueva Milod6n, a cave sediment section, near the forest/steppe boundary (51 ° 35 'S, 72 ° 38 ` W, 100 m elevation ; Moore, 1978 ; Markgraf, 1985 -)La Misidn, a bog in Patagonian steppe (53 ° 30 'S, 67 ° 50 ` W, 3 m elevation ; Markgraf, 1980a, b, 1983 -)Fells Cave in Patagonian scrub-steppe (52 ° 4 'S, 69 ° 7 ' 30W, 250 m elevation ; Bird and Bird, 1988 ; Markgraf, 1988) .
